channel.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time

item.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

Yea that’s what i did put the double hit on a player doesn’t work.

edit: I don’t know about the last part.

switch (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) { case 18371: // Gravite Staff damage *= .05; case 4675: // Ancient Staff case 4710: // Ahrim's Staff case 4862: // Ahrim's Staff case 4864: // Ahrim's Staff case 4865: // Ahrim's Staff case 6914: // Master Wand case 8841: // Void Knight Mace case 13867: // Zuriel's Staff case 13869: // Zuriel's Staff (Deg) damage *= .10; 
	case 15486: // Staff of Light
		damage *= .15;
		
	case 18355: // Chaotic Staff
		damage *= .20;
		
	}</blockquote>

But what does it mean?

switch (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) {
case 11235:
case 15701: // dark bow
case 15702: // dark bow
case 15703: // dark bow
case 15704: // dark bow
return 9;
case 13879:
return 8;
case 15241: // hand cannon
return 9;
case 15037:
case 11730:
return 4;
case 14484:
return 5;
case 13883:
return 6;
case 10887:
case 6528:
case 15039:
return 7;
case 13905:
return 5;
case 13907:
return 5;
case 18353:
return 7;
case 18349:
return 4;
case 16955:
c.doubleHit = true;
return 3;
}
I did this already.

Also there is this

public static int finalMagicDamage(Client c) { double damage = c.MAGIC_SPELLS[c.oldSpellId][6]; double damageMultiplier = 1; if (c.playerLevel[c.playerMagic] > c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]) && c.getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]) >= 95) damageMultiplier += .03 * (c.playerLevel[c.playerMagic] - 99); else damageMultiplier = 1; switch (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) { case 18371: // Gravite Staff damageMultiplier += .05; break; case 4675: // Ancient Staff case 4710: // Ahrim's Staff case 4862: // Ahrim's Staff case 4864: // Ahrim's Staff case 4865: // Ahrim's Staff case 6914: // Master Wand case 8841: // Void Knight Mace case 13867: // Zuriel's Staff case 13869: // Zuriel's Staff (Deg) damageMultiplier += .10; break; case 15486: // Staff of Light damageMultiplier += .15; break; case 18355: // Chaotic Staff damageMultiplier += .20; break; }

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time

item.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:521424”]Can you post the actual code instead of the bits you added? it’d be helpful[/quote]I believe that’s all the code he modified for the double hit.

In PI, in class CombatAssistant, there’s a switch statement (getAttackDelay). It switches through item ID’s. It returns with an integer representing the delay of the attack. So,

    public int getAttackDelay(String s) {
        switch(int itemId) {
            case 16955: //the item ID
                c.doubleHit = true; //boolean declaring whether the weapon uses double hits
            return 3; //the delay of the attack

@OP:
You did put your case under:

switch (c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]) {

Right?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

I want it to double hit both npcs and players. But when it hit’s players the second hit is always a zero, but when it hits npcs it double hits correct.

item.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:521424”]So wait. You want it to always double hit NPC’s. but single hit players.
Then you say the second hit on a player is never above a 0.
Doesn’t seem to be an issue here.[/quote]He was saying that it never going above 0 is the issue.

item.title: [PI] Making a melee weapon double hit every time
item.dc:creator: @hotkid8200 hotkid8200
item.description:
@hotkid8200 wrote:

How do i make a melee weapon double hit every time on an npc and on a player! I added this case

case 16955: c.doubleHit = true; return 3;

Under this : public int getAttackDelay(String s) { (in combatassitant.java)

It works on npcs, but when i attack a player it does this 50-0, 34-0, etc the second number on a player is always a 0!!! on a npc it works 100% Please help!

Read full topic
